main.name: Pranav Kulkarni
main.occupation: Masters Student of Software Engineering @ University of Maryland (Fall 2018-2020)
main.description: I have strong interest in the field of Software Developement, AI/ML, Finance, Robotics and any combination of these. I am proficient in Javascript, Python, C++, R, MySQL and have an experience working in React/Redux, Node & Express JS, High-performance/Super computing platforms, PostgreSql, Pandas, Postman, Git, SSH, ArcGIS, ROS & Linux. I am currently looking for full-time positions from May 2020 in any of the following: Software developer, full-stack developer, React/Redux developer, Javascript developer, Front-end developer, Back-end developer, Python developer, C++ developer
main.bio: I was born and raised in a lovely city called 'Pune' in India. After my basic schooling there, I did my graduation from the Indian Institute of Technology Patna, India from the department of Mechanical Engineering (2012 - 2016). Currently, I am doing my Masters in Software Engineering from the University of Maryland (Fall 2018 - 2020). Apart from my strong liking towards Software Development and coding in general, I like reading books especially from mythology, mystery, science fiction, business/entrepreneurship & political satire genres. I also like watching good movies and I am a big fan of Christopher Nolan and Denis Villeneuve. Apart from all of this, I do enjoy playing chess in the pass-time.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Short visual summary of some of my skills

education.description: Have undertaken courses in Software Architecture, requirements, Systems Engineering, AI Planning and Life-cycle cost estimation. Currently a graduate research assistant to Dr. Varaprasad Bandaru at Dept. of Geographical Sciences.
Received Director's 'Best Graduate Thesis Project Award 2016', Published a paper in American Society in ME and was selected in coveted MITACS Globalinks scholarship.

work.company: Dept. of Geographical Sciences, University of Maryland
work.title: Graduate Student Researcher
work.description: I have developed 7+ packages & supporting modules for performing data extraction, pre-processing, bias-correction and down-scaling of CFS and SubX Multi Model Ensemble (MME) satellite-based weather datasets (200+GB in size). Apart from this, I have also automated and increased the efficiency of GIS based data analysis system used for conducting large scale simulations at high-spatial resolutions by using EPIC crop model by reducing its simulation time by ~ 60%. Finally, I have also performed EPIC crop model simulations for 3 different crops (from 2012-2015), its subsequent post-processing and validation at national-scale (with ~ 1KM spatial resolution) and I am currently in-process of publishing the results.
work.environment: R, Python, high-performance clusters, Bridges & Comet super computing platforms, SSH, Linux.

work.title: Web application developer
work.description: I have developed full-stack interactive web-applications for 1. Visualization based asset allocation computing tool for investors as Beta-manager (https://beta-manager.herokuapp.com/) & 2. Tool for detecting celebrities and human faces in uploaded image as CeleFace (https://celeface.herokuapp.com/). I have also developed 3+ wireframes & 7+ UML diagrams for UX design, internal application flow and state management and worked as an implementation lead for developing prototype of online cooking learning management system named MasterCook (https://mastercook613.herokuapp.com/) for semester-wide course project in a group of 6.
work.environment: React/Redux, Express & Node JS, HTML5, CSS3, PostgreSql, Firebase, Postman, Heroku, Git.

work.company: Quantitative team @ Smith investment Fund (SIF) - UMD
work.title: Technical Lead
work.description: I developed REST API for ‘Beta’ parameter computation, Hierarchical Risk Parity (HRP) computation & for asset-screener for ‘Quality Companies at Reasonable Price (QARP)’ software model. (More info on SIF can be found at https://www.umdsmithinvestmentfund.com/). I have also conducted 2+ Q&A sessions & lecture series on ‘Intro to Basic SoftDev tools’ for new recruits in the club.
work.environment: Python, Pandas, Selenium, Google datalab, Quandl, Git.

work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: I assisted to Dr. Huan Xu, for developing RESTful API for generating an optimized multi-robot control policy based on automata learning of environmental dynamics to satisfy given LTL specifications with maximum probability. For developing the same, I studied 15+ related research papers and conducted path planning simulations by leveraging public packages.

work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: I developed an optimized feedback algorithm for automated trajectory planning of ferromagnetic microbots used for targeted cell deliveries via cell-micromanipulation in presence of undesired forces and sensing noise. For this project, I received Institute’s ‘Best Graduate Thesis Project Award 2016’ for the developed algorithm and prepared thesis. I was also able to publishe and present the research findings in ASME 10th International Conference on Micro-Nano systems. By leveraging the developed algorithm, I developed the framework for accurate and fast tracking of pre-defined trajectories by microbots and led the team of 4 for the ‘Mobile Micro-robotics Challenge 2016’ (organised by IEEE RAS) to achieve the rank of top 3 finalists.
work.environment: Python, C++, pygame, SimPy, MATLAB, Linux.

work.title: Project Manager
work.description: I was lead CNC mill programmer for 3, 4 & 5-axis bar fed mill for development of prototypes & production parts. Apart from this, I also performed regular troubleshootings and enforced Lean 5S throughout the shop for maximizing operator time & safety.

work.title: Officer – Retail Upgradation
work.description: I worked as an interface between customer and developers for implementation of retail automation software at 103+ outlets. For the same purpose, I used to extract requirements from customers for troubleshooting, product support & improvement in developed software. I also worked closely with development team for requirements prioritization and quicker and improved resolution of first ticket issues.
